situation.title: Higher Vocational Schools
situation.meta_description: Personal attendance in vocational colleges is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Personal attendance in vocational colleges is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020. This means that secondary school students can't go to school at this time. Schools established by the Ministry of Justice and schools working alongside establishments for institutional and preventative children's care are exempt.

Practical education will also not be going forward, with the exception of medical specializations, who will continue in practical education.

The reason is the current epidemiological situation and a high risk of infection. A lot of children meet in the classroom for a long period of time, they are also in direct contact with their teachers and parents. This is connected to a risk of infection and a lot of people who could potentially be infected.
